definitions.definition: The water - soluble part of the ash formed by burning plant material ; used for making soap and glass and as a fertilizer .
An impure form of potassium carbonate (K 2 CO 3 ) mixed with other potassium salts .
Potassium . Chiefly used in the names of compounds of the form "... of potash".
A class of potassium minerals, of similar applicability to potassium carbonate , such as being a fertilizer. (ie. potassium chloride , potassium hydroxide )

main_definition: The water - soluble part of the ash formed by burning plant material ; used for making soap and glass and as a fertilizer .
secondary_definitions: ( chemistry ) An impure form of potassium carbonate (K 2 CO 3 ) mixed with other potassium salts .
( chemistry , archaic ) Potassium . Chiefly used in the names of compounds of the form "... of potash".
A class of potassium minerals, of similar applicability to potassium carbonate , such as being a fertilizer. (ie. potassium chloride , potassium hydroxide )
